# showsExpansionTextWhenTruncated

**Instance Property**

A Boolean value that determines whether the full text of the label displays when the pointer hovers over the truncated text.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var showsExpansionTextWhenTruncated: Bool { get set }
```

## Discussion

A label may truncate text too long to fit in its container based on the value of the label’s [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UILabel/lineBreakMode] property. To provide the option in your app to show the full text when the pointer hovers over the truncated text, set [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UILabel/showsExpansionTextWhenTruncated] to [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true]. The default value is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false].





## Accessing the text attributes

- **text**: The text that the label displays.
- **attributedText**: The styled text that the label displays.
- **font**: The font of the text.
- **textColor**: The color of the text.
- **textAlignment**: The technique for aligning the text.
- **lineBreakMode**: The technique for wrapping and truncating the label’s text.
- **lineBreakStrategy**: The strategy that the system uses to break lines when laying out multiple lines of text.
- **isEnabled**: A Boolean value that determines whether the label draws its text in an enabled state.
- **enablesMarqueeWhenAncestorFocused**: A Boolean value that determines whether the label scrolls its text while one of its containing views has focus.
